Description: Four (six in January 2018, P M Pearce, Conservation) joining fragments of rim, wall and handle of large North Ionian black-figured bowl; interior glazed save for thin reserved band near lip; two added red bands lined in white; exterior slipped cream; frieze of short verticals at lip; in handle zone sejant black-figure sphinxes facing right, red on hair and wings; sparse rosette fill; outside of round handle glazed, with reversed palmette between roots and spirals with florals to either side; below, key maeander band between glaze bands with superimposed red bands lined in white; lower frieze of goats grazing to left, above two bands of ornament; white dipinto inscription on inside.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 768, pl. XXI, no. 768)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 243, no. 5)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 683, no. 419)
Villing & Schlotzhauer 2006 / Naukratis and the Eastern Mediterranean: Past, Present and Future (p. 6, no. 41)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.265)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 1012, pl. 125)
